intro: Canthium kilifiense, commonly known as Kilifi spurge, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its milky sap and often spiny structures. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, adapting to saline and arid conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
